page.title: 03MAY DAY AND THE MAYPOLE/1
page.content:
In the centre of Holywood stands one of the last Maypoles in existence. It is used to celebrate the coming of summer on the 1st May. This celebration takes place around the Maypole, for instance Scottich Dancing, Irish Dancing and sometimes Disco-dancing.
How the Maypole ever got situated in Holywood is unknown, but there is a traditional story behind it. A Dutchman, in the early 1700's and his crew were said to have been shipwrecked. They put the main-mast of their ship at the intersection of the town's two streets, decorated it with flowers and partnered the women of the town for dancing. But nowadays instead of flowers decorating the Maypole, they have little ships.
